column5: Has the snow fall for the winter in the area from LOW to the Nakina area been anywhere what could be considered normal, or has it been less? Thanks,
I'm guessing the snow has been less than normal over most of the area. Is this a fair assumption? And that we can expect low lake levels unless there are some heavy spring rains?

From everything I have heard up there, the snow has been less than normal. Unless we get a couple big blasts of snow, or the heavy spring rains, water will continue to be down. If things don't improve, it might make for a bad spawning season this year. Greg Bolinski Agate Bay Lodgewww.agatebaylodge.com NPAA #944

My outfitter (Arctic Watershed Outposts) in Nakina reports that this winter has been mild with minimal snow and same for rain in the fall. Will need a VERY wet spring or all lakes will be low. This makes for difficult landing for float planes along with difficult fishing.
